website_summaries.verdict: Light as a feather but tough as nails, these synthetic leather dance shoes hold up through demanding routines.
pros: Durable, but not too thick, soles and comfortable insoles
Last through weeks or months of dancing
cons: Size may run a bit small, and shoes may be too narrow for some feet
Synthetic material doesn’t breathe or flex as well as real leather

customer_reviews.title: Runs VERY small and VERY narrow
customer_reviews.text: ordered 11.5 WIDE. I wear an 11 street dress shoe. These were so small I couldn't get my foot in. They were also VERY narrow, not "WIDE" at all. I held them sole to sole with my dress shoes and they were at least 2.5" shorter and about 1.5" narrower. INSANE sizing. I've returned and will try a 13W. Maybe that will fit?
customer_reviews.author: KWA ColoradoTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: ... taking dance lessons for our wedding and we'd actually like to continue dancing beyond that
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my fiancé since we're taking dance lessons for our wedding and we'd actually like to continue dancing beyond that. He wears a 12 W "street" shoe and I purchased a size 13 W in these and they fit pretty well. If you're a beginner in ballroom, these will do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: hwatts

customer_reviews.title: Great dance shoe - IF you get the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I have nice big duck feet. Hate tight in the toe. Depending on the maker of a shoe, I wear 9.5-11. Based on the reviews, I went for the 9.5, would have been much happier with 10. They are tight in the toe. But overall, they are comfortable. Next pair will be larger and my satisfaction will go up and I will be able to wear more than a couple of hours at a time
customer_reviews.author: Average American Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe - Size "as expected"
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for a good price. I tried a different style Capezio in a dance store and had to go down a size from my street shoe. I thought I would order this shoe 1/2 size larger just to be safe which is still 1/2 size smaller than my street shoe. Mistake! I ignored the majority of the reviews indicating size "as expected". Don't ignore the reviews. Buy according to your street shoe size! I returned the shoes for a size the same as my street shoe. They fit great and feel excellent! I no longer have the shoes to blame for the less than perfect dancing. (grin)
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but upsize it.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 10.5 Wide and based on other reviewers, this is what I ordered. They were too tight, primarily in the toe, so I returned them for an 11 Wide. That pair is also tight in the toe and I will likely try an 11.5 Wide (a size I've never worn before) but first I'm trying alternate socks. I recommend you order at least a half size larger than you need and perhaps even a full size. Other than that the shoes are good looking and of high quality. I plan on sticking with them once I get the sizing figured out.
customer_reviews.author: MarkinNM

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe...sizing confusing
customer_reviews.text: These are good shoes but I am very confused about sizing. I ordered a size 10M for my teenage son and they fit perfect. Then, he lost them. I reordered the EXACT same pair of shoes and they are at least a size too big on his feet. I checked the box and shoe and they say 10M. I wonder if the first pair were wrong (really a size 9M) or if the sizes are not consistent. I now do not know how to reorder to get his correct size.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Way to small.
customer_reviews.text: This is the smallest 8 wide I have ever tried on. I do not believe that the shoe was accurately labeled. Its either a womens shoe or a smaller size. I've been told that this is a decent dancing shoe. Unfortunately I will never get the chance to find out.
customer_reviews.author: REJ

customer_reviews.title: Top shelf quality
customer_reviews.text: Okay they are not $500+ imported Italian dance shoes, but they are expensive and absolutely worth it. Perfect fit for me, Men's size 11, 1 inch heal, and I have a wide foot and a larger than average bone that rotrudes from my heal. These are perfect. I've tried the cheaper ones and they are all garbage. Any cheaper than this and you lose SIGNIFICANT quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Tim Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, lightweight dance shoe....
customer_reviews.text: These are a comfortable, lightweight, flexible, good quality ballroom dance shoe. The fit is typical for dance shoes, which is to say they run small....so order 1/2 to 1 size up from your street shoe size. My husband is typically between an 11.5 and a 12 in street shoes....we ordered a 12.5 and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: buffalogal

customer_reviews.title: Way too small!
customer_reviews.text: If you can see the picture: Left: Woman's size 9.5 Center: This shoe, size 10.5 Right: Men's size 10.5 This shoe is more than 1 inch shorter than other men's shoes of the same size. They are so small, I didn't even try to fit my feet into them. I had to give them a low rating because I couldn't even put them on to evaluate them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim2B

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, although the size is a gamble :)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes as a gift for my husband. His regular size is 11, but after reading all the reviews I decided to order 12W. When the shoes arrived, I compared them with his sneakers, and it looked like these shoes are too short, but when he tried them on, he said they are a bit too long, and a bit narrow, but overall it is an ok fit.
customer_reviews.author: HoleyFiber

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, but fit like they were 2 sizes too small... Sent them back. I have 14W feet and bought 14W. Another company had that size (same quality) for the same m9ney and fit great.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with sizing
customer_reviews.text: These shoes seem to run very small. I bought the same size as my previous pair of ballroom shoes of another brand. Those fit perfectly, but these seem to be about a whole size too small. The comments say to 'break them in' but beware, I have been wearing these consistently for a month expecting improvement, and now I am left with nothing but blisters, foot cramps, and a pair of $70 shoes I can't wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller Toe Box and Lesser Quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my dance shoes, now 15 years old, with the same and reordered these shoes. The new shoes had a smaller toe box and were not as well made as my present shoes. The new model is made of a single, thinner piece of leather and I noticed that the heel was shorter, front to back. Because of the smaller toe box I returned them. So, if you are ordering these shoes remember to order one half size larger than your present Capezios.
customer_reviews.author: SSUMM

customer_reviews.title: Order at least one size larger
customer_reviews.text: First, placed three orders before getting shoes that fit comfortably. They definitely run small! I ended up with wide sole shoes a full size larger than what I normally wear, so keep that in mind when ordering. Shoes are comfortable, but have very little arch support. I've only wore them to one ballroom dance lesson so far, so can't speak to durability, but shoes were comfortable to dance in and I'm happy with them so far...after finally getting a pair that fit.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 13 in street shoes so I ordered the same size in this dance shoe. Perfect fit. I have a narrow foot and these shoes fit like a glove. Wore them to dance class tonight and they made all the difference in the world. Felt soles and a good solid heel for your foundation. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Capt GH

customer_reviews.title: The seems like a decent enough quality though
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 10 and a half wide in the shoe and I couldn't even get my foot in it. I am guessing that I would need to order a size 13 or so in order for this shoe to fit. I had to send it back. The seems like a decent enough quality though. I gave three stars because the size is so far off.
customer_reviews.author: JASON P THOMPSON

customer_reviews.title: I would give them 5 stars if they came in ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give them 5 stars if they came in a narrow width! I've never had issues with shoe size or width, but this is very loose in my regular size. They buckle a lot at the top when I tie them, so I am assuming they are too wide for my feet. I am going to try to use some arch supports in them to see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: LShaw

customer_reviews.title: Capezio Men's Ballroom Dance Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These men's ballroom dance shoes arrived early in excellent condition, as expected. As with any ballroom shoe, they are meant to fit snugly at first so the leather can stretch and conform to your feet as they are broken in over time. You can speed the process along by folding them forward and back and beating the soles, just as you would work a new baseball cap. Also you will need to roughen up the suede bottoms with a steel shoe brush to maintain the proper floor grip and keep the soles from getting slippery. Great low cost dance shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, does the job
customer_reviews.text: I went half a size up to ensure that it fitted. Possibly I'll find that as time goes on, the leather will stretch and they'll be too big, but we'll get to that hurdle eventually. Looks good, does the job, any issues with the dancing are as a result of me as opposed to the shoe. They've been holding up after my first competition and quite a few practice sessions, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Overall I'm happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm happy with the purchase, but I'd say the shoes run a half size smaller than expected. I'm noticed a little breaking in after several hours, but next time I'll order a little larger size from Capezio to anticipate this drawback.
customer_reviews.author: Proft

customer_reviews.title: Still too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a half size larger than I normally wear in hopes it would be a comfortable fit. Alas, these shoes are simply too narrow and, thus, painful. I don't understand why there are no truly wide dance shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Adams

customer_reviews.title: Slightly big
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were just a bit too big and wide for my son's feet. Otherwise, they were as expected and will work for his upcoming musical. However, they came in packaging that was damaged - the box was completely torn on one side and the outer packaging was also torn nearly halfway through. We picked them up off the porch minutes after they arrived so this damage definitely occurred during transit. The shoes seemed to be ok despite the packaging being torn apart.
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Leah Moore

customer_reviews.title: All you have to do is stretch them! :)
customer_reviews.text: This isn't going to fit as expected out of the box. They were tight at first when I first got them. But after stuffing the toe of the shoe with tube socks (stretching the shoe hack) 2 days prior to wearing them, they fit like a charm! I did have to get them 1/2 size bigger because they do run a bit small, but nonetheless, after stretching them, I'm very happy with the purchase!!! I would definitely buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: A. Carrion

customer_reviews.title: Insane sizing. TOO SMALL.
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear anything from a 13 W to 13.5 (when I can find it) and 14 (safest bet.) I purchased 13.5 M, 14 M, 14 W. The 14 W was actually quite a bit smaller (both length and width) than the size 13 M Coach shoes they’re replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grammer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable leather, but run small.
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 10 shoes. Because of their shape and construction, I bought a half size bigger and the shoes fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rob F.

customer_reviews.title: High quality at good price, fit well and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted shoes for ballroom dance lessons, and I found this shoe to be the best choice because it had really good reviews and the company seemed reputable. The product itself is pretty good and high quality. I've worn them to just one dance lesson till now, but I was wearing them for two hours and they were comfortable throughout. The product page advises ordering the same size as your street shoe. I wear US 12.5 Nike running shoes, and ordered the same size. They fit pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Aditya Chanana

customer_reviews.title: Too small and charged for return
customer_reviews.text: Tight fit. Approved for refund and then I was charged $25 for the return.. for a $60 pair of shoes. Really? Never again.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Salsa shoes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and kept size 7 as other reported shoes being one size too small. That was the case. I just used them in Medellin for 51 hours of salsa dance lessons. They are great. Buy them. Comfortable and stable. I have wide feet. I did put my own insoles in them as I have high arches.
customer_reviews.author: Thunder Snow aka ADB

customer_reviews.title: First Dance Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I really know nothing about dance shoes but I just started ballroom dancing and these are very good for my needs. They fit very snug, as is necessary for dancing, but they are not uncomfortable. I suspect they will loosen with time but this will not be an issue as the fit seems just right for the job. My instructor says dance shoes do not last long in general so durability is not really an issue if I keep at this pace. They look fine. No complaints, they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: seabumb

customer_reviews.title: buy it 1/2 size larger than your street shoe
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the other reviews about size problems, I took a chance and ordered the shoes 1/2 size larger than I normally wear. The fit in the larger shoe is perfect, so, my advice to accept that the shoes are cut a little small and just order them a bit larger. Looking forward to wearing these out.
customer_reviews.author: BWP

customer_reviews.title: Dance shoes, worked for my latin salsa class.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes definitely run small, I am a size 13, so upon reading reviews I purchased the size 13.5 and it worked out well. I do not normally dance and needed these for a dance class and I could definitely feel the difference in terms of regular shoes vs dance shoes...they will let you glide. I do not trust these shoes long term, but then again dancing shoes are not meant to be worn extensively. If you wear these for dancing, they will do the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Better  Than expected
customer_reviews.text: Surprised to see Capezio made in China, (too small in my usual (10 1/2 EE) Ordered 11 EE still tight , **Returned** for 11 1/2 EE (Wide) possibly a little wide nothing a thicker sock won't handle.. Happier with Quality of 2nd Pair- Leather doubled on heel over Bloch product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Worst product I've ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: They looked great and fit well but cracks started appearing across the toe area on both shoes the first time I wore them. After the fourth time wearing them the cracks started peeling back on both the inside and outside. I know Capezio is a good name in dance shoes so I wonder if these were counterfeit or cheap clones?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel I Smith

customer_reviews.title: True to size and perfect for the ballroom dancer
customer_reviews.text: What a difference real dance shoes make! As a ballroom novice I wondered what all the hubbub was about - until I tried on a pair of real dance shoes. My local studio didn't have my size, so I turned to Amazon for the perfect fit. These were spot on as far as size, and make a HUGE difference on the dance floor. The 1" heels are theoretically intended for Latin dances, but I find them perfect for smooth as well (good thing, since my favorite dance is Waltz). Recommended without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: JPM

customer_reviews.title: Very light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Still breaking them end. Are very light. Were a little tight at first but seemed to stretch a little. Wish they would have came with a bag and brush as similar products does. Will keep posting on them thanks
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great for organ shoes
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking organ lessons this semester and needed organ shoes, which are really hard to find -- talk about a niche market! These are theoretically dance shoes, but they work great for organ. The fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest academic

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these! He wears them for Argentine Tango and they look great and feel great. He does have a narrow foot so that might make a difference. We tried the size 10 thinking he'd need to size down but returned those for his actual size.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Not men's shoes. When I measured them against a ...
customer_reviews.text: Not men's shoes. When I measured them against a pair of my shoes (ladies's 8 1/2) they were barely an inch longer. No way were my husband's size 10 feet going to fit in those. They get 3 stars for accepting returns graciously. I ended up taking my husband to a brick and mortar store, ordering shoes from them and 3 weeks later, he FINALLY had appropriate shoes for dance classes.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna Tassin

customer_reviews.title: Decent shoe, comfy, holds up okay.  wish it was cheaper
customer_reviews.text: Decent shoe, comfy, holds up okay. wish it was cheaper
customer_reviews.author: Tim R.

customer_reviews.title: The Description was Wide but they are Extra Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited when I saw a description which said said 14 Wide! In some shoes I wear normal width but my experience with dance shoes convinced me to go for the wide version. While 13 normal actually fits my foot, I wear orthotics inside my shoes so I normally buy 14 M (normal width) shoes. Not only were these not wide! They weren't even close to normal width! I estimate that they were actually Extra Narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Truth

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, order your street shoe size
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6 and wear a 12.5 street shoe. I ordered a 13W and it was slightly to long and to wide. I recommend ordering your street shoe size. Shoe seems to be decent. Would recommend for a beginning/intermediate dancer. I've used them for 3 weeks so far, (10 hours a week) and they have broken in nicely and don't show any signs of non normal wear. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: About what you expect
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price. Pretty much as expected. There isn’t much give so if in doubt go up a size.
customer_reviews.author: Lipstick Addict

customer_reviews.title: mens capezio shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the next size up in a wide for my husband after reading the reviews. they fit him perfect and he can dance so much better
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality ballroom shoe. After only ONE time wearing, for a 40 minute lesson, this is the destruction on the shoe material. So disappointing. We have bought Capezio brand ballet shoes for almost a decade and the ballet shoes are great. The brand reputation does not carry over to their ballroom shoes. Absolute junk.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: and glad I did
customer_reviews.text: They tell you to order a w if you wear a normal width and that is correct. I wore these for a couple of hours to break them in before my first lesson. and glad I did. I think the complaints from people about them being to narrow after going a size up in the width department are just not used to dress shoes period. So far I have no complaints. I will try to update after having worn for a longer time.
customer_reviews.author: baddog1229

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for dance, classes or practice sessions.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes,with ballroom (felt) sole, are soft as gloves. The fit for me was excellent. They are exceptionally light and appear well-made, with no gaps between the soles and the very relaxed, soft leather. Highly recommended for indoor, dance class or dance sessions.
customer_reviews.author: G. B. C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit of these shoes. My only complaint would be the PU leather used for the upper portion. It is a combination leather base with plastic on top. It's not bad but it doesn't breathe like real leather.
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and fit just fine
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 1/2 size larger then regular shoe size as suggested by pervious reviews. They are very comfortable and fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: SUZ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tango shoes
customer_reviews.text: GREAT tango shoes. They don't run large as others seem to report, so maybe there are some inconsistencies in sizing? I ordered a 13.5 wide originally when I normally wear a size 13 shoe. I sent them back for a 13 regular and they fit perfectly. These are really comfortable, and great to dance in all night.
customer_reviews.author: RideTheSpiralToTheEnd

customer_reviews.title: These look and feel great to dance in
customer_reviews.text: These look and feel great to dance in. Important Note: order a 1/2 larger than what you normally wear because shoes run a little small.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy near Philly, PA

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit and Support
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for two weeks -- so two evenings of dance and two hours of lessons. The main reason I bought online was to improve the fit -- I need a 2E -- and to pick out something with good arch support. The fit is perfect and the arch support is very good. These are among the least expensive of the shoes I viewed, so I consider them a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Snug
customer_reviews.text: These are my first dance shoes. I have short but wide feet so these shoes are pretty snug. They are tighter than "regular" shoes but my dance instructors tell me that is how it is supposed to be so I guess they fit as needed. They do help me feel the contact with the floor better and slide nicely. I've only used them twice so far but am satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great quality dance shoe - love it!
customer_reviews.text: thought I'd take my chances order a dance shoe online. Many feedback items suggested ordering one size larger, which I thought would have been too big, so I ordered 1/2 size up, which fit great. They arrived promptly and were reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe.  Buy a full size larger than what you normally wear.
customer_reviews.text: These size small, as has been noted by other reviewers here. Because of that I bought a full size larger than I'd normally get, and the result was just right. The first time I wore them I got a heel blister, but after a week with shoe-trees in them they performed much better the second time out. The soles have just the right amount of slip and grip on a dance floor. Overall a very nice dance shoe.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Gawne

customer_reviews.title: It is great for the most dance you do
customer_reviews.text: I had this shoes for one year, it is durable. I dance for 5 days per week. It is a little bit wore out now, think about have another pair. It is great for the most dance you do. Latin, Ballroom smooth, Swing, And I'm a begin, but I think it meets all my requirement.
customer_reviews.author: Hong Zhang

customer_reviews.title: A solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Durable. The shoe is ok, looks fine and the sole feels ok for tango. Nothing special,but does the job. The only problem - sizes are smaller than expected
customer_reviews.author: Mit

customer_reviews.title: Performs as they should
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat snug fit at first, but they loosen up. These shoes held up after more than 20 hours of dancing. Performs as a dance shoe should -- great for social dancers and beginners.
customer_reviews.author: RebDi

customer_reviews.title: Really well made, true leather dance shoe. Only ...
customer_reviews.text: Really well made, plastic upper, suede leather sole dance shoe. Does smell like chemicals. Only wear this on the dance floor. It will be ruined if you wear it outside.
customer_reviews.author: Arlen

customer_reviews.title: I've owned two pairs and competed in them
customer_reviews.text: Both pairs fit as expected. The quality is strong and the feel is great. I keep the first pair for practice and only use the second pair for competition. After a year of dancing 3+ times per week the felt has pretty much all worn off and I'm going to try using a super sticky re-felting kit and see how that goes
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Stalley

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - run too smaill
customer_reviews.text: nice shoe. runs a size to a size and half too small
customer_reviews.author: Mwbenson1728

customer_reviews.title: Order a wide fit of you are not, trust me!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT quality, the felt on the bottom for ease of movement and turning is not cheaply attached and I'm certain they'll last a while for my husband. However, they are TIGHT around his foot. I can see him wiggle his pinky toe from the outside of the shoe! It does not fit like a sneaker and you MUST order a wide fit if you are not normally a wide!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice shoe... only thing was the material began to peel shortly after the first use. They served the purpose we bought them for, but for someone who needed regular use of a product like this one should know they did start to wear out very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: rosemarie montague

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied. Easily Wears down.
customer_reviews.text: Wore it for a couple of weeks and then started seeing the wear and tear. The stiching has started to come off a bit and the insole is also not fixed anymore. Not happy with it. I wish I had noticed the wearing earlier, could have returned it for another pair or could have asked for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: VTheAmazonianJ

customer_reviews.title: Humorously too small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 11 wide and they were laughably too small. The label on the shoes indicated 11 wide but they were about a typical 8 regular. Other than that they were just what I was looking for so I give ‘em a three.
customer_reviews.author: seeker

customer_reviews.title: Wide sizes very narrow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the wide shoes a half size larger than my normal size and it was still way too small. It was really narrow, even narrower than a regular sized shoe. It was impossible to find a Capesio that fit my feet. I ordered a whole size larger and it fit fairly well for size, but it was still really, really narrow. I returned them to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: E. McFarland

customer_reviews.title: First time buying shoes online...won't be the last!
customer_reviews.text: The idea of buying shoes online never appealed to me, as I like to ensure a proper fit and don't want the hassle of repeated returns. However, I followed the guidance from other reviewers on this style (go up one size in length and width), and found they fit perfectly. I have been tremendously pleased with the simplicity and convenience of this purchase, and will undoubtedly make use of this system again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zieg

customer_reviews.title: Good Dancing Shoe for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I find these shoes to be a quality, very attractive, comfortable dancing shoe for the money. I'm a big guy, and take a 13 EEE shoe. Yup, good luck finding that in a dance shoe! These were the largest available at the time of purchase. Even though they are somewhat small in length and width, they remain comfortable. I recommend purchasing a full size larger and wider than your street shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Marc L. Mintz

customer_reviews.title: Other then that they slide well and look great.
customer_reviews.text: I have only worn them for about a week so far but they fit perfectly. The bottom of my feet hurt the first day because my feet are not used to the minimal padding of dance shoes yet but my feet are getting used to it now. Other then that they slide well and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Best on smooth wood floors
customer_reviews.text: Dance quite often on polished wood floors, smooth concrete and smoothed over asphalt which is still rough one the soles and toes. Best on smooth wood floors. As much as I dance, I can wear out the tips in about three to four years. I have the heals repaired a couple times.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Rather narrow, but functional. I am not a ...
customer_reviews.text: Rather narrow, but functional. I am not a dancer, so a critical review is beyond me. The GF wants me to learn to tango...tango shoes.
customer_reviews.author: RonV2

customer_reviews.title: Order 1 size larger, 1 width wider. Or Else you will be returning them!
customer_reviews.text: I wear 11M syreet shoe and boots. BELIEVE ME , after reading reviews I ordered 1 full size larger (12 W) to fit my 11m normal size. They fit perfect! ORDER 1 SIZE LARGER , 1 WIDTH LARGER! THEY ARE NICE SHOES FOR DANCE ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: Alonzo long

customer_reviews.title: Nice dance shoes for big guys.
customer_reviews.text: I like these dancing shoes. They fit well and are supportive even for us larger guys. Definitely need to brush the bottoms and break them in. So far so good. They look nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck N

customer_reviews.title: No Fit
customer_reviews.text: No way these are "size 9's" - I've bought 4 pair of dance shoes online, sight unseen, and this is the first pair ever I've had that didn't fit - not even close. I'm not even sure these are 8 1/2's - more like 8 1/4's, maybe? Be aware - order larger than you need! They're a GOOD quality dance shoe, well-made - just a tad small!
customer_reviews.author: M. Long

customer_reviews.title: Shoes for the groove
customer_reviews.text: I can get away with them with a shoe strech I just have to get a size a little big other than that I'm satisfied it's just for a one last dance video that I'm going to do which is special to me it's a long story turning back the clock 🕴🏾🤠🤠🤠🤠
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Osborne

customer_reviews.title: and the shoes fit fine. They have sort of a suede-like sole and ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other customer reviews, I discovered the shoes run small. So, I ordered a size larger, and the shoes fit fine. They have sort of a suede-like sole and are designed to work best on wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett P. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my dance shoes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my dance shoes! They're comfortable, pliable, and (perhaps most importantly) they look very dignified and like the shoe a gentleman would wear!
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable pair for socials
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable pair for socials. If you are looking to start ballroom dancing, i have no issue recommending these shoes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I suggest u look at this comment!
customer_reviews.text: It’s like it could be wider and I would do a whole size up not a half size up a whole size up!
customer_reviews.author: alonte williams

customer_reviews.title: I've worn others and I like these much better
customer_reviews.text: Although my first pair of shoes, I've worn others and I like these much better. The style is sleek and they slide well. I would recommend going smaller than you are in regular shoes, at least a half size. Even if it's small, you can use various methods to stretch them out. I ordered two pairs of these through Amazon prime and I was very happy with how quickly they came and the price compared to other websites. I dance at least three times a week (various ballroom and Latin dancing). These were perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Degnan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered another brand and they were fine. We're the Capezios midsize do
customer_reviews.text: Ordered & received size 10 which I have worn for years. Shoes received were way too small and narrow. Ordered another brand and they were fine. We're the Capezios midsize do?
customer_reviews.author: Fred P. Slack

customer_reviews.title: Great but need to order bigger
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great. I got them for my husband and our beginner ballroom dance class - they are perfect for that. However, they do run small. And after my own experience with women 's capezio shoes I ordered a size larger than street shoes. Worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: AnnaVM

customer_reviews.title: Shoes run small... Delivery was excellent
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend getting a size half to full size larger on this dance shoe. However if you have a stretching insert, then only a half size larger would work. I use these shoes for my organ playing. Delivery was surprisingly great! Much faster than any expectations! FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Combs

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: If you have wide feet, do not buy this. I normally wear a 10.5 EEE and these were so tight that I had to take them off after five minutes at dance class.
customer_reviews.author: Kameron Stover

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The size of this shoe surprised me. It was so narrow. Attached is a picture of a regular 14w shoe next to this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had to order this shoe twice and it seemed like the half-size larger that I ordered was narrower than the half-smaller size I ordered previously. Very disappointed with their sizing consider the style and cost of these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hooper

customer_reviews.title: so far I like them for swing dance
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size larger than normal and fit okay. Very light and great to dance in, as I hardly know I am wearing shoes at all.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners!
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. If anything I would say they were a little small width-wise on my feet. However maybe that is just how organ shoes need to be. They really made a difference when I was learning to play the organ.
customer_reviews.author: JGibbons

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely perfect. I got these to use on the organ, so I don't wear them much, but they fit perfectly and are surprisingly comfortable. I honestly wish I could wear these more. :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: But one night of dancing proved comfortable. The shoe stretches after some use
customer_reviews.text: The first try-on seemed a bit tight. But one night of dancing proved comfortable. The shoe stretches after some use. Great value, apparently as good as my first Capezio that cost $30 more.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Junker

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice thus far
customer_reviews.text: Reviews said this brand was good. Seemed a little tight when first tried them on, but I've danced in them once and worked well for me. Look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit - Can Dance All Night!
customer_reviews.text: I could dance all night with my wife of 48 years. The felt bottom makes dancing to the music of the 40's - 60's a great pleasure versus street shoes that have too much friction. The price is about 40% less than that which can be sourced from "dance suppliers."
customer_reviews.author: California Tennis Player

customer_reviews.title: it would have been nice if they included a brush and bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a ballroom dance class and they work fairly well for what they are. They do fit a little snug so I listened to other reviews and got a half size bigger. For the price I paid, it would have been nice if they included a brush and bag. Breaking them in wasn't too bad. After a single class I could feel the floor quite well and turns were a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: L. Esposo

customer_reviews.title: Shoe size not what indicated - the shoes run one or more sizes smaller.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is well made. But the size ordered and the size labeled in the shoe is not the true size . The shoe was supposed to be a ‘wide’ size but actually would not even go on my foot. So, I sent the shoes back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Wreck58

customer_reviews.title: Quality dance shoe.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these. Fit is a bit tight but expect that this may improve as the shoe breaks in
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: First dance shoe - were recommended by people who have experience as a quality
customer_reviews.text: Fit true to size. First dance shoe - were recommended by people who have experience as a quality shoe
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Basic and functional
customer_reviews.text: I started ballroom dancing 8 months ago. After a couple of months I decided to stick with it and I needed dedicated shoes to practice in. These fit the bill and have held up to dancing 3-4 times a week (usually 45 minutes to an hour) for the last six months.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered my regular size 11 and they were small. I ordered 11-1/2 and they were perfect. Although not leather, they seem to be quit sturdy and easy to care for. Make sure to get a small wire brush to keep the suede soles in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: John Steed

customer_reviews.title: narrow feet/wide shoe
customer_reviews.text: Haven't worn them out on the dance floor yet, but just trying them on at home, I may have to opt for a thicker sock to get them to fit decent. Or they may get returned. Afraid if I order the 1/2 size smaller that they will then be too short.
customer_reviews.author: S. BARKER

customer_reviews.title: These are great looking shoes and does not have a stiff flex
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking shoes and does not have a stiff flex. Runs a bit small so I ordered 1/2 size larger which worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Capezio Men's SD103 Social Dance Shoe
product_meta.description: Salvatore Capezio was born in 1871 in Muro Lucano, Italy. Uninterested in following in his father's footsteps as a construction engineer, he became an artist of his own right, a cobbler. In 1887, at the age of 17, he opened his shop on Broadway and 39th Street, diagonally across from the old Metropolitan Opera House in New York City. Soon, the shop became a meeting place for dancers who would stop by to discuss their needs and to get a pair of his shoes. As Capezio's popularity grew, dancers from around the world made it a point to visit him and purchase his shoes. The innovation of the products that Salvatore Capezio created and the camaraderie he shared with the dancers molded the direction that his company would follow. In this image, the Capezio brand was established to promote and recognize ongoing achievements and participation in dance. Capezio products remain in the forefront in quality and in technological advances with innovations like the split-sole, the stretch-insert, the Dansneaker and the Tapsneaker. Capezio believes that their success is dependent upon the individual commitment of each customer to continually set new standards of creativity and performance, while preserving a reputation for dependability and distinction. Capezio pledges their support and dedication to the advancement of dance, theater and recreation in communities worldwide.
feature_bullets: Lace-up dance shoe in faux leather featuring one-inch heel with suede-covered bottom for shock absorption
